required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Renal Colic Fast Track Pathway in the Emergency Department.
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised Controlled Trial to Assess a Renal Colic Fast Track Pathway in the Emergency Department Using Point-of-care Ultrasound and Point-of-care Testing.

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundacion para la Investigacion Biomedica del Hospital Universitario la Paz

clinical_study.source: Fundacion para la Investigacion Biomedica del Hospital Universitario la Paz

brief_summary.textblock: Validation of a high-resolution, fast track pathway that combines the use of laboratory tests at the Point-of-Care Testing (POCT) and Point-of-Care ultrasound (POCUS) versus the classical pathway, in which blood samples are sent to the central laboratory and comprehensive radiological exams ordered, being equally effective, at a lower cost of care and time of stay in the emergency department.

primary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in the Emergency Department

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of conclusive exams in the Point-of-Care intervention arm.

intervention.description: Point-of-Care ultrasound + Point-of-Care blood gas testing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- First renal colic episode
- Need of analgesia
- Oral tolerance
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hemodynamic instability
- Fever
- Anuria
- Abdominal trauma
- Chronic renal failure
- Active oncologic disease
- Kidney transplant or monorenal patient

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fundacion para la Investigacion Biomedica del Hospital Universitario la Paz
responsible_party.investigator_title: Attending physician, Fellow director of the ultrasound division in the emergency department, principal investigator.
